sub_title: Working with interested stakeholders to put an end to nuclear weapons.
summary: Specialties: controversial weapons policies and multilateral disarmament negotiations & fora, non profit organisational development, humanitarian disarmament, Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons

treasury_media.title: Ban Nuclear Weapons Now | by Anne-Marie Slaughter & Susi Snyder - Project Syndicate
treasury_media.description: Weapons designed to mass murder civilians, terrorize the world, and enable impunity for war crimes can no longer be relied on to “prevent war.” Russian President Vladimir Putin’s aggression in Ukraine and his willingness to brandish the threat of nuclear weapons will spur a renewed drive to rid the world of them.

treasury_media.title: Susi Snyder, Nuclear Disarmament Program Manager for PAX No Nukes in the Netherlands, to be Tanner Center for Human Rights Speaker at Hinckley Institute

awards.title: Nobel Peace Prize
awards.description: Prize motivation: "for its work to draw attention to the catastrophic humanitarian consequences of any use of nuclear weapons and for its ground-breaking efforts to achieve a treaty-based prohibition of such weapons" .  https://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/peace/laureates/2017/

awards.title: Nuclear Free Future Award
awards.description: Since 1998 the Nuclear-Free Future Award honors people worldwide who create a world free of nuclear power and nuclear weapons. The various places of our annual awards show the size and diversity of the global anti-nuclear movement. Our laureates are heroes and heroines working to pull the plug on nuclear power, or to pound nuclear warheads into ploughshares. Many are the visionaries and architects of a future lived in sustainable harmony with the earth, men and women energetically seeding fresh solutions.

projects.title: Don't Bank on the Bomb
projects.description: “Don`t Bank on the Bomb”, is the only report to detail how private and public financial institutions from around the world invest in companies involved in the production, maintenance and modernization of nuclear weapons. Depending on their investments and practices, financial institutions are divided into a global “Hall of Shame” or “Hall of Fame”.  The report is published annually, and the associated campaign is ongoing.

projects.title: International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN)
projects.description: The International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN) is a global campaign coalition working to mobilize people in all countries to inspire, persuade and pressure their governments to initiate and support negotiations for a treaty banning nuclear weapons.

contributors.headline: Working with interested stakeholders to put an end to nuclear weapons.

projects.title: Withdrawal Issues
projects.description: What do NATO countries really say about the deployment of U.S. tactical (or sub-strategic or non-strategic) nuclear weapons? Many assumptions have been made, and repeated in countless reports by the media and experts over the last few years. However, Netherlands-based IKV Pax Christi set out to interview all 28 NATO delegations, as well as NATO staffers concerned with nuclear planning and deployment, to ask how they assessed the future of tactical nuclear weapons deployment in Europe. The result of these interviews is now available in the report: Withdrawal Issues: What NATO countries say about the future of tactical nuclear weapons in Europe.

profile_positions.company: International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN)
profile_positions.description: The International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN) is a global campaign coalition working to mobilize people in all countries to inspire, persuade and pressure their governments to initiate and support the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons.  The International Steering Group is responsible for campaign governance.

profile_positions.title: President -UNO, Inc.

profile_positions.description: The Geneva NGO Committee for Disarmament is a substantive committee of the Conference on NGOs, CoNGO.  The Committee works to enhance NGO participation in disarmament discussion and decision making fora in Geneva, including the Conference on Disarmament.
profile_positions.title: President

profile_positions.description: The Conference of Non-Governmental Organizations in Consultative Relationship with the United Nations (CONGO) is an independent, international, non-profit membership association of non-governmental organizations (NGOs). It facilitates the participation of NGOs in United Nations debates and decision-making. CONGO is most active at the major UN centres of New York, Geneva and Vienna but its work stretches out to all regions of the world.
profile_positions.title: Board Member

company.name: Women's International League for Peace and Freedom (WILPF)

profile_positions.company: Women's International League for Peace and Freedom (WILPF)
profile_positions.description: The Women's International League for Peace and Freedom (WILPF) is an international Non Governmental Organization (NGO) with national sections, covering all continents with an international secretariat based in Geneva, and a New York office focused on the work of the United Nations.  The Secretary General (SG) is responsible for the overall implementation of the policies and programmes of the organization as mandated by the WILPF triennial Congress, the International Board, and the International Executive Committee.  She coordinates activities and actions for membership in over 40 countries, drafts organizational policy, coordinates research and advocacy and manages the international secretariat in Geneva and the United Nations office in New York.
profile_positions.title: Secretary General

profile_positions.description: Shundahai Network was originally formed at the Nevada Nuclear Test Site in 1994, by a council of long-term nuclear disarmament activists, at the request of Corbin Harney, a Western Shoshone Spiritual Leader. We have evolved into an international network of activists and organizations bridging the gap between the environmental, peace and justice and indigenous land rights communities.
profile_positions.title: Program Director
